Light Label & Text Dark Group Bar Always Show Group Bar Reset All Icons Reset All Labels Move All to Selected Default Groups
When this service is enabled, Lightning Launcher will open automatically when you hover the cursor over the App Library icon on the right of dock for about half a second.\n(This may make it difficult to access the default launcher)\n \nMake sure to enable the \"Use Lightning Launcher\" switch - the \"Lightning Launcher Shortcut\" switch won\'t do anything on the Quest!
[App Library]
Runs in Own Window Launch in Own Window Once Refresh Icon / Banner
Launching 2D apps or websites in their own window allows for easier multitasking on Quest devices, but will cause certain apps to not always launch.\n\nIf you have any issues, disable this option! Turning this option off will hide the top bar when not in Edit Mode. \n \nThe settings button will also be hidden when not in Edit Mode.\n \nTo turn on Edit Mode, press the back button on the top of the window, or B on your controller.
Websites in Lightning Launcher Easily Access Web Pages & Apps
Websites will appear as apps on your home screen, and will open in a custom browser in the same window. Any 2D website works.\n \nZoom and dark mode preferences are saved for each website. Audio in the Background
After being closed, websites will continue running, playing and recording audio in the background.\n \nAn indicator will be shown on the icon of any running website;\nPress it to fully stop that website.
Add a Website Add a Website to the Launcher Enter Any Website URL Enter a valid URL and try again Added websites can play audio in-game Add to %s
Launcher Shortcuts Easily Access Lightning Launcher By enabling the shortcut service, Lighting Launcher will open when you hover over the App Library icon on the right of the dock, essentially replacing the default launcher.\n\nAlternatively, you can use the LauncherShortcut apk provided on the GitHub. (Make sure to carefully read the instructions in the README if you choose this option) Enabling the Shortcut Service 1. Use the button to open Android\'s accessibility settings\n2. Tap on \"Lightning Launcher\"\n3. Switch the service on (or off) at the top of the page\n4. Tap \"Allow\" on the prompt Continue to Accessibility Settings
Important Info Cancel Got It! Confirm Continue
Turn On Edit Mode Turn Off Edit Mode
Tap an app to or tap here to select 1 app selected, tap a group to move it %d apps selected, tap a group to move them Moved an app to %s Moved %d apps to %s Cleared selection Selected all visible apps
An update is available! Update from version %1$s to %2$s, without taking off your headset! Continue Skip this Update
Downloading Update You should get a prompt to install in a few seconds Hide
Skip updating to version %1$s? You will not be notified about this update again.\n \nKeep in mind that updates are highly recommended and may include important fixes.\n \nIf you are avoiding this update because it causes issues, report your issues at github.com/threethan/LightningLauncher\n \nYOU CAN UPDATE LATER FROM THE SETTINGS! I Understand, Skip It Just Dismiss
